info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 24 at 10:27PM EDT until August 24 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WAYNE COUNTY... At 1027 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Romulus, moving east at 50 mph. There is also a second severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado over Belleville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Dearborn around 1040 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include New Boston, Inkster, Wayne, Westland, Garden City and Dearborn Heights. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
